item.title: Volume Rendering for 3D Data Visualization
item.description: Introduction Volume rendering is a collection of methods to visualize volumes, which we often encounter in scientific, engineering, and biomedical domains. Volume datasets are essentially sampled 3D scalar fields: \( f[m, n, k]: \mathbb{N^3} \rightarrow \mathbb{N} \). We refer to the pairs of 3D coordinates and their corresponding intensity values as Voxels (the 3D equivalent of pixels). Volume rendering can be divided in three main categories: 2D visualization of slices of the volume, known as MPR (Multi-Planar Reconstruction) Indirect 3D visualization - Isosurfaces Direct 3D visualization known as DVR (Direct Volume Rendering) Let’s examine each category separately.
